_header: Right mighty Prince and it be your will
_description: John Lydgate, letter to Gloucester for money — eight 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc) including Envoy; refrain ‘Onely for lak of plate and of coignage’ or refrain phrase ‘plate and of coignage’

CamMagPep2011.First Lines:
Right myghty prynse and hit be youre wylleCondiscende leyser for to
                    take…
CamMagPep2011.Last Lines:
…God sende sone a gladder letuaryWith a clere sone of plate
                    and of coignage
CamMagPep2011.Attributed Title:
This is the letter that Daun John lidgate Monke of Bury sent to humfrey
                    duke of Glouceter for mony for making of Bochas (f. 78); Explicit littera de
                        dan John lidgate (f. 79)

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
[R]ight myghti prince and it be your willeCondescende leyser for to
                    take…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…God sende sone a gladder letuaryeWith a clere sowne of plate
                    and of coyngnage
BLAdd34360.Attributed Title:
Explicit littera Dompnus Iohannis Lydgate / Monachus Monasterij on
                        Edmundi de / Bury missa ad Ducem Glowcestrie in tem / pore Translicionis
                        libri Bochasij per / Oportunitate pecunie (f. 65v)

PierpontM4.First Lines:
Right myghty prynse and hit be youre willCondiscende leyser for to
                    take…
PierpontM4.Last Lines:
…God sende sone a gladder letuaryWith a clere sone of plate
                    and of coynage
PierpontM4.Note:
Includes last two stanzas as envoy, ‘O sely byll why arte þu
                    not ashamed…’ (76v-77).
PierpontM4.Attributed Title:
This is the copy of þe letter that dan John lidgate Monke of Bury sent
                    to homfrey duke of Glouceter for mony for the makynge of Bochas (f.
                        75v)
PierpontM4.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A New Lydgate-Chaucer Manuscript.” 
             Modern Language Notes
         52 (1937): 1-9: 2-4.
